com.kuka.roboticsAPI.applicationModel.tasks

Interface IRoboticsAPITaskInjectableTypes


  • public interface IRoboticsAPITaskInjectableTypes
    The following types and services are available for injection with @Inject.
    In cases where there is more than one instance, @Named must be used for disambiguation.

    • Scene graph services and its root object World:
      • World
      • ISceneGraph
      • ITemplateService
    • Objects in the scene graph which represent a topology item (resource):
      • com.kuka.sensitivity.LBR in the sensitivityCommon
      • RoboticArm
      • Tool and derived (custom) types
      • PhysicalObject and derived (custom) types
      • VirtualObject and derived (custom) types

      • Purely geometric objects can't be injected.
        The recommended way of obtaining such objects is by using findObject().
    • Services and data:
      • ITaskUI
      • ITaskLogger
      • ObserverManager
      • IProcessDataManager
      • IProcessData individual objects (must be used in combination with @Named)
    • Application specific control types:
      • Types listed in RoboticsAPIApplication

    • Generated IO-Groups:
      • All generated IO-Group types. Every IO-Group type will be injected as Singleton.
    • Capabilities:
      • All capabilities of resources
      • All capabilities of spatial objects that represent a topology item
    Notes:

    Injection can only be used in the declaration area of a class or method, not inside of body of methods. The example below will show how to use injection in tasks:

    File RoboticsAPI.ProcessData.xml 

    <processDataContainer version="4"\>
   <processData dataType="java.lang.Boolean" defaultValue="true" displayName="Do process" id="doProcess" value="true"/>
   <processData dataType="java.lang.Boolean" defaultValue="false" displayName="Is empty" id="isEmpty" value="false"/>
   <processData dataType="java.lang.Integer" defaultValue="0" displayName="Example Integer" id="counter" max="100" min="0" value="82" comment="This is a comment."/>
   <processData dataType="java.lang.String" defaultValue="0" displayName="Example String" id="OtherChannelParam" value="Param for OtherChannel">
       <channel id="SmartHMI" isWriteable="true"/>
       <channel id="OtherChannel" isWriteable="true"/>
   </processData>
</processDataContainer>

    Example application (also valid for background tasks) 

    public class InjectionExample extends RoboticsAPIApplication {
   @Inject
   private ITaskLogger logger;
   @Inject
   private Tool gripper;
   @Inject
   @Named ("doProcess")
   private IProcessData startProcess;

   @Override
   public void initialize() throws Exception {
       // ...
   }

   @Override
   public void run() throws Exception {
       // ...
       if (startProcess.getValue()) {
           logger.info("Process starts now.");
           gripper.move(lin(...));
           // ...
       }        
       // ...
   }
}
